abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Forest Development Project, examined the status, trends, and
            institutional capacity for forest management in Romania, and
            key issues of the National Forest Policy, and Strategy. It
            assessed the project environmental impacts and proposed
            mitigation measures. Although the project will have
            positive, beneficial impacts, there are aspects which could
            have negative environmental, and social consequences if
            mitigation is not implemented. Adverse environmental
            impacts, and mitigating measures are as follows.
            Institutional recommendations suggest capacity building -
            formal, and on-the-job training, public awareness, etc. - to
            ensure compliance with environmental policies, including the
            involvement of public-private partnerships, to support an
            enabling environment. The main concern is the Forest Roads
            component, which involves road construction and
            rehabilitation in the area: baseline conditions, site
            selection, and engineering design will be reviewed to
            minimize adversity. Also, poorly managed forestry harvests
            may be endangered by increased timber industry demand, if
            institutional capacity measures, and public-private
            partnerships do not exercise regulations, a risk greatest in
            the case of newly restituted forest lands. The update
            volumes clarify issues and incorporate recommendations
            raised by NGOs, detail information disclosure, further
            examine illegal harvesting, and expands on the reasons for
            rejecting alternative projects.
